title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that total revenue will increase and/or does not explain that demand is price inelastic in this price range; or use numbers to explain that the percentage decrease in quantity demanded is less than the percentage increase in price, the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is less than 1, or the total revenue increases.

The response states that total revenue will increase and explains that demand is price inelastic in this price range; or uses numbers to explain that the percentage decrease in quantity demanded is less than the percentage increase in price, the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is less than 1, or the total revenue increases.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, the firm is producing at the allocatively efficient quantity and/or does not explain that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve (at 16 units).

The response states that yes, the firm is producing at the allocatively efficient quantity and explains that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve (at 16 units).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that at 12 units the firm’s economic profit is negative (or there is an economic loss) and/or does not explain that the price is below the ATC.
The response states that at 12 units the firm’s economic profit is negative (or there is an economic loss) and explains that the price is below the ATC.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain that at 20 units marginal cost is greater than average total cost, which means that the cost of producing the next unit is higher than the average total cost, which pulls up the average total cost for the next unit.

The response explains that at 20 units marginal cost is greater than average total cost, which means that the cost of producing the next unit is higher than the average total cost, which pulls up the average total cost for the next unit.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the consumer surplus as $54 and/or does not show the work:

Consumer Surplus =   1 2 (12)($30−$21)=$54 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaae4qaiaab+ gacaqGUbGaae4CaiaabwhacaqGTbGaaeyzaiaabkhacaqGGaGaae4u aiaabwhacaqGYbGaaeiCaiaabYgacaqG1bGaae4CaiaabccacaqG9a GaaeiiaiaabccadaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaacaaIYaaaaiaacIcacaaI XaGaaGOmaiaacMcacaGGOaGaaiijaiaaiodacaaIWaGaeyOeI0Iaai ijaiaaikdacaaIXaGaaiykaiabg2da9iaacscacaaI1aGaaGinaaaa @553F@

The response calculates the consumer surplus as $54 and shows the work:
